attributes.action: To lower the legal driving age to16 in the UK
attributes.background: I would like to lower the legal driving age to 16 as at this age you can take on many adult responsibilities such as paying tax, join the army, leave home, pay adult tickets on public transport.
attributes.additional_details: The Australian process of learning to drive is three fold where learners are required to log their driving experience throughout the learning. Young adults must display the relevant 'P' plates to show the stages of learning they are at such as Red P plates to green P plates to full license.

attributes.action: Campaign for greater involvement of the UK in the refugee resettlement
attributes.background: The reason for this petition is because we believe that the UK isn't allowing the enough number of refugees into the UK. Also we should be allowed to be part of the decision of allowing refugees in or not because at the end of the day it is the public who put decision makers in power.
attributes.additional_details: As we have put the decision makers in power they need to understand that without us they wouldn't be in power and also the reason they are in power is so that our voice can be heard.

attributes.action: Make tattoo discrimination illegal
attributes.background: Tattoo discrimination, especially in the work place, should be made illegal, judge people by their talent, not by looks

attributes.action: Make it an offence Not to have a 'Poo Bag' on them in a Public Area.
attributes.background: With a number of Dog Owners 'NOT' picking up their Dogs Fouling Footpaths, Common ground and All other Public places, something needs to be done, Owners when asked 'Must' produce a waste bag or face a Fine or Ticket, also it makes sense that these Bags are Biodegradable which is not the case now.
attributes.additional_details:
We walk our dog and see in just our small area Owners pretend to pick it up with no bag in their hands and walk off after looking around, children and adults walk on it, on footpaths around schools a large amount left, it creates a Health issue as well as a long term Environmental impact with some owners after picking it up throw the bag into an overgrown area with the bags not breaking down.

This needs to be included in the Dog act with the Police having a scanner for chips and other checks.

attributes.action: Consider a second runway for Gatwick
attributes.background: Why allocate a 3rd runway to Heathrow when Gatwick will fund 2nd runway

attributes.action: Increase the number of years required to be eligible for UK citizenship
attributes.background: If refugees or persons with humanitarian protection can stay in the UK for 5 years and then be eligible for UK citizenship after 5 years, it discourages those from ever returning home once it is safe to do so.
attributes.additional_details: In Norway you have to wait 7 years, in Germany you have to wait 8 years, in Switzerland 10 years, and so on. I think there is a debate to be had about increasing the number of years to be eligible for UK citizenship.

attributes.action: To create an intermediate tier paper for maths GCSE (all exam boards)
attributes.background: Many students taking the higher tier maths GCSE paper, struggle with the contents, but find the foundation tier too easy. I am petitioning for an 'inbetween paper' that allows students of 'medium ability' to be able to get higher than a grade C at GCSE.

attributes.action: all road traffic accidents with police attendance should have a written report
attributes.background: 18 months ago I was knocked off my motorbike whilst filtering slow moving traffic by somebody who went to change lane without indicating, and with no police report and a witness who doesn't seem to want to give a statement I'm struggling to prove the events with my insurance company.
attributes.additional_details: The day after my accident I called the police and spoke to the attending officer who confirmed I was knocked off whilst filtering and the other driver had attempted to change lane without indicating. I also called the witness who confirmed that I was travelling in a safe manner and the other driver swerved to change lane without indicating and obviously being unaware of his surroundings and myself.

attributes.action: STOP Council Housing Benefit taking student loans into account as an income!
attributes.background: Currently if you are a university student and receive a maintenance loan the councils in UK include this as an income when evaluating a housing benefit claim! This is a loan to be paid back after graduation, not an income or bursary!

attributes.action:
Create non-geographical parliamentary 
constituencies for our Armed Forces.
attributes.background: Depending on individual circumstances, service personnel register to vote using an address which is either: their current address; one where they would reside but for their service, or a previous address. Thus personnel at any one location may be represented by MPs, from across the political divide.
attributes.additional_details:
Our Armed Forces deserve to elect their own MPs, rather than have them chosen by an electorate with little appreciation of service life and the conditions under which the military operate both here and abroad.
Without independent representation, or a formal federation, our Armed Forces are unable to make their views known in a coherent manner.  Non-geographical constituencies will enable service personnel to elect their own MPs, wherever they serve or live, and be seen as an identifiable entity.

attributes.action: No child maintenance for parents refusing access without legal reason to.
attributes.background: Parents who refuse access for other parent should not be entitled to any maintenance for that child if they cannot provide legal reasons and evidence for why they are refusing access. All attempts should be made by all parties involved to resolve outside the courts whenever possible.
attributes.additional_details: The relationship I was in dissolved when my then partner fell pregnant when I was in German with the Army, so I applied for early posting back to the UK and was posted to the south but my partner lived up north, I could only afford to travel once or twice a month, my partner said it wasn't good enough. I made journeys to see my child and on arrival was refused access which left me struggling financially,  Travel £240 a month maintenance £250 wasn't feasible. I live north now and still no access.

attributes.action: Urge the US president to apologise for humiliating Johnson Beharry VC
attributes.background:
The PM should make direct representations to POTUS and demand a public apology be made to HMQEII.

Johnson Beharry VC was delayed entry to the US after the POTUS ordered travel restrictions on 27 January 2017. He missed a veterans' event where he was due to be a guest of honour.
attributes.additional_details:
Johnson Beharry VC is a member of the British Army who won the UK's highest military honour for bravery in Iraq in 2004. He suffered significant injury in doing so. He described he "felt humiliated" during recent experience at JFK Airport.

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/donald-trump-muslim-ban-johnson-beharry-victoria-cross-humiliated-a7563451.html

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/johnson-beharry-victoria-cross-war-hero-humiliated-donald-trump-travel-ban_uk_58970829e4b0768562164564

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4192774/Victoria-Cross-war-hero-Johnson-Beharry-humiliated-US-border-officials.html

http://www.standard.co.uk/news/world/victoria-cross-hero-johnson-beharry-humiliated-after-being-caught-up-in-donald-trumps-travel-ban-a3458696.html

attributes.action: Reduce the foreign aid contribution from 0.7% to 0.2% GDP
attributes.background: In the current climate of government cuts to our Local authorities, NHS and social funding (specifically OAP) it is completely unacceptable to be sending approximately 12 billion pounds of UK tax payers money out of the country when our own services are failing.

attributes.action: Introduce routine drug & alcohol testing to all adults working with children.
attributes.background:
Parents we need to take control of what our children are exposed to.
We are asking all parents to stand up for our children, sign our petition & insist that anyone working with under age children including school teachers must have compulsory routine drug & alcohol tests.

attributes.action: British & European Citizenship for those who wish to remain a part of Europe.
attributes.background: Given that there is precedent for dual nationality in N.Ireland I feel it is only fair, and morally right, that as just under half of the country didn't want to leave the EU that those who wish to stay should have the option to keep European citizenship when Brexit negotiations begin.
attributes.additional_details:
I was born in N.Ireland and as I grew up I was told I was N.Irish, Irish, British and European. I had a choice on who I affiliated myself with and I had a choice to be a part of something smaller, or something bigger; I chose the latter.

It is therefore, with precedent and just under half the country having voted to remain, that the government should not ignore what is a large minority and give everyone the rights that others in these islands already have.

Choice on citizenship!

attributes.action: Make the Asylum seeker dispersal scheme mandatory to all councils in the U.K.
attributes.background:
The process in which Asylum seekers are granted housing in the U.K. is dependant on councils that volunteer to be part of the scheme. 
Currently, there is no mandatory requirement for all councils to participate meaning that councils are able to, and do abstain from the effort.
attributes.additional_details:
The humanitarian crisis we are facing should not be left only to those councils most willing, as it creates an unnecessarily large strain on some councils that should be shared. 

At least 38 councils have not signed up to the scheme which includes the rehoming of refugee children who entered the UK alone. 

The current voluntary system is unfair, and means that schools, healthcare resources and other public services in participating councils are needlessly overstretched.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum asking if we want to leave the single market.
attributes.background: On 17th Jan 2017 Theresa May announced the government decision to take the UK out of the single market. As during the previous referendum it was not clear whether voting leave would trigger a single market exit, allow people to have their say in light of this new information.
attributes.additional_details: NB this does not mean a re-run of the original referendum. The new referendum would instead determine whether the majority of the British people would prefer a 'soft' Brexit, with continued access to the single market but no controls on EU immigration and continuing EU fees/directives, or a 'hard' Brexit, with controls on immigration, full sovereignty and no EU fees, but no access to the single market.

attributes.action: Incentivise employers to accept CVs over application forms
attributes.background: The government should be working to make getting a new job as fast and simple as possible, yet those seeking work have to fill out forms that outline the same information in slightly different formats over and over again. The government should incentivise streamlining the job application process.
attributes.additional_details:
It is deeply inefficient for employees to repeatedly redraft their contact details, educational qualifications, and job histories, during every single job application. 

It would radically increase labour market efficiency if companies accepted CVs containing general information, followed by more specific questions about the candidates aptitude for the advertised role.

Candidates could then apply for more jobs in less time, shrinking their level of requirement for tax funded welfare support.

attributes.action: Consider a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt, Secretary of state for Health
attributes.background: The Independent exposes the collusion of Jeremy Hunt,  Department of Health and the HEE  to impose junior doctor contracts. Health Education England is meant to be an INDEPENDENT body  responsible for the teaching and training of health care staff. Mr Hunt cannot be trusted with future of our NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
6th January 2017 article in the Independent 
Emails show Jeremy Hunt’s Department of Health 'colluded' with ‘independent’ body to impose junior doctor contracts
Emails seen by The Independent reveal collaboration with Health Education England, which provides NHS trusts with £3.65bn of funding every year

attributes.action: To allow free parking for up to three hours on all NHS hospital car parks.
attributes.background: The NHS state that they are making no profit from car parking charges, this cannot be correct when a Press Association report states that the NHS raised £120,000,000 (120 Million pounds sterling) from charges last year, up 5%.

attributes.action: Men to be given automatic parental responsibility like women when a baby is due.
attributes.background: Woman have fought hard for their equal rights and they got it, which is just right, but when it comes to pregnancy men do not have the same rights as women and I aim to change that. I am a father to be and I have discovered that a father has to be registered on the birth certificate to have the....
attributes.additional_details: same rights as the mother to their new born child unless courts say otherwise. I want you to ask yourself something, what happens when both parents break up and the mother has a severe dislike to the father? lots of people act out of anger. The father has to pay thousands of pounds just to see his child a few days a week when he probably doesn't deserve that kinda treatment. people judge today by the actions of stupid men in the past but if we are all equal then why is the father the outcast?

attributes.action: Stop all foreign aid payments at the beginning of the next fiscal year.
attributes.background: We need to reallocate all funds to projects within the UK, such as homeless shelters built in every city in the UK with a full time GP, medical and social care staff including drug and alcohol abuse, PTSD, catering and educational facilities and education and retraining facilities.
attributes.additional_details: That for a period of one year no foreign aid be paid and that at the end of that year, the government then uses a jury picked in the same way as the current judicial system to hear each case of requested aid from foreign countries. Furthermore that a list of qualifying criteria is put in place prior to any allocation of funds. Such as no country with a GDP higher than ours can request money, that the goverent of the country is an elected one, that the country does not have a nuclear program.

attributes.action: Urge UN deployment of observers for safe evacuation of civilians and rebels
attributes.background: The Syrian Regime has failed to allow safe passage for besieged civilians and rebels to leave Aleppo and has resumed shelling. Thousands risk being massacred. The UK Government must support and urge the UN to deploy International Observers to facilitate the evacuation of all civilians and rebels.
attributes.additional_details:
As of the 14th of December 2016, France's Foreign Minister has called for the deployment of UN observers, but this has not been raised to the UN, nor does it stipulate safety for all civilians and militants. 

"What France demands is the presence of observers of the United Nations on the ground to have a guarantee that the evacuation, which is a priority for the civilians, [takes place], but also so that militants are not massacred," (Jean-Marc Ayrault - quoted by Les Echos newspaper).

attributes.action: Provide anonymity for those accused of sexual assault until they're found guilty
attributes.background: While we find complete sympathy with all men and women who have been raped, the anonymity provided to the accusers must be extended to the accused until a verdict is reached. Careers are easily destroyed on allegations alone - even when the accused is found innocent. The imbalance is unjustifiable.
attributes.additional_details: In many circumstances in the past careers and livelihoods have been ruined by such allegations - even when the accused were eventually found innocent in a court of law. For many of the same reasons that the accusers are granted anonymity, we should extend this to accused to allow them protection from public scrutiny until they are found guilty.

attributes.action: Make Helium Balloons Illegal
attributes.background: I am always seeing helium balloons. Helium is a limited resource so should not be used for balloons, especially as helium can be used for important MRI scanners. This gas is lighter than air and will never be seen again if it floats away. So please support me in my hope to ban helium balloons.
attributes.additional_details:
When pressure becomes too much for a balloon it will pop, and the foil balloon will land in the ocean- a innocent sea creature will eat it and die.
Helium is a limited resource and is needed for MRI scanners to work. Helium is the only element out of all 118 in the periodic table that can cool the electromagnets to the right temperature for the scanner to work. One day helium may save your life.

attributes.action: Put the £369 million going into Buckingham Palace into the NHS.
attributes.background: I have been sat in the Children's A and E at the UHW for the past two hours. There are not enough seats, children sat on the floors and mother's with babies sat on baby chairs. There are not enough doctors on and it is evident the longer waiting times are distressing the children and young people.
attributes.additional_details:
During my girlfriends pregnancy, she had to wait 3 days to have her waters broken as there was not enough midwives to give the necessary supervision.

There was a mis-communication with medication due to staff being so busy they missed that she had already been administered. This could have led to an overdose. 

I have also just used the toilets at the UHW and attempted to wash my hands in three different cubicles. There is no soap in the dispensers and no running water in the sinks.

attributes.action: Make it law for companies to let applicants know if they have got a job or not.
attributes.background: When we apply for a job many of us find that we don't hear a thing back from the company concerned.  This has to stop, not only is it downright rude of a company/employer small or large to not tell people if they did not get a job.  I think it also has a negative affect on confidence.

attributes.action: Restrict noise of fireworks at organised displays to a maximum of 120 decibels
attributes.background: Fireworks sold to members of the public are subject to a restriction of 120 decibels. I ask that all fireworks are subject to this restriction as those used at displays are becoming rediculously load causing terror and suffering to animals and young children

attributes.action: Make England have BST during winter and  BST + 1 hour during the summer.
attributes.background:
The advantages include:
-increased daylight during the afternoon.
-energy saving from lighting being delayed, producing reduced carbon emissions;
-reduced roads accidents
-health benefit from afternoon sunlight and outdoor exercise
- benefit the tourist trade
- no cost to UK exchequer
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Society for the Prevention of accidents is in favour of GMT + 1 hour in the winter and GMT + 2 hours in the summer as more people are killed on the road as a result of the earlier afternoon darkness in the winter caused by our current winter time of GMT.

attributes.action: Investigate motor insurance policy pricing to ensure it is fair for everyone.
attributes.background: Motor insurance is a legal requirement and a social utility, but the transparency in policy pricing and post inception activities of insurers in recent years, is disadvantaging consumers and was not addressed in the Competitions and Markets Authority's investigate of 2013/14.
attributes.additional_details: The recent article from uSwitch.com, ( http://tinyurl.com/z2w83bh ), highlights that those seeking to save money by opting for third party only or third party fire and theft cover, are actually being charged more than for comprehensive cover. As motor insurance is a legal requirement, it is felt that insurance companies should be both transparent and accountable for their pricing structures, for such a economically vital, social utility as motor insurance, so that consumers are treated fairly.

attributes.action: Increase the bursary for training English teachers 2016-17
attributes.background:
The government are increasing the bursary for training English teachers from a minimum of £4,000 to £9,000 for all.
Many who are training to teach English this year will only receive £4,000 to cover living expenses. If they had applied this year they would receive over double the amount.
attributes.additional_details:
https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/funding-and-salary/overview

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/561599/Initial_teacher_training_bursaries_funding_manual_2017_to_2018.pdf

attributes.action: Make diagnosed medical need the same as disability for discrimination laws
attributes.background: As someone suffering from diagnosed coeliac disease, I am appalled that there is no legislation which protects our rights (and those with other medically diagnosed conditions) from discrimination, unless that diagnosis happens to be recognised as a disability in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst restaurants, cafes and other public bodies and places have to make reasonable adjustments for people with disability, there is no requirement for them to do likewise for a medically diagnosed condition, such as diabetes and coeliac disease.

Hospitals often fail to provide any gluten free menu options for coeliacs and despite NICE guidelines, the NHS trusts are withdrawing prescriptions for gluten free food, the only treatment for coeliacs (yet still prescribe food for other conditions).

attributes.action: Immediately stop and cancel IHAT investigations into British troops
attributes.background: There are investigations into British troops conduct in the Gulf area.  These were initiated by Gordon Brown.  Some investigations are still ongoing and pending, it is totally unfair to do this, our troops are the best in the World and should not be investigated in this way.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to require disclosure of current  salary on a job application
attributes.background: Candidates are often dismissed as unsuitable if their current salary is more than 10% removed from the salary of the role they are applying for.  This discourages career advancement as well as job mobility between industries with different pay grades.  Candidates should be assessed on merit alone.
attributes.additional_details: Employers use current salary as a baseline to make an offer to a successful candidate, leading to a situation where two candidates can be paid vastly different amounts for the same role – this discourages social mobility and gender equality by ensuring that employees who are paid less than their colleagues are unable to catch up even when moving jobs.   Candidates can also fail to be considered for a role if their current salary is not in the same range as the role they are applying for.

attributes.action: Create mandatory recycling waste legislation in England
attributes.background: In Scotland - the regulations brought in, in January 2014, require all businesses and organisations to separate key materials – plastic, glass, metals, paper and card – for recycling, while most food businesses are also required to separate food waste for collection.
attributes.additional_details:
- See more at: http://www.zerowastescotland.org.uk/content/meeting-regulations-legislation#sthash.tem8wOF6.dpuf

The government needs to catch up with other, more forward thinking and environmentally aware countries to legislate on waste recycling as a matter or extreme urgency, to prevent the needless, toxic pollution of our earth, on which, all humans depend for their existence!

attributes.action: Not using signals correctly when driving should be a criminal offence
attributes.background: Introduce a fine for incorrect use of indicators at junctions and roundabouts.
attributes.additional_details: Incorrect use of signals cause unnecessary hold ups and leads to accidents

attributes.action: Review extra funding for m60 ring road and m56 and other adjoining motorways
attributes.background: Traffic chaos all around m60 ring road ever y day adding as much as 2 hours on to the journey , major problems Include m56 junctions 3 to 1 heading East to m60 anticlockwise at junction 3 cheadle
attributes.additional_details: M56 narrows to 2 lanes to join m60 4lanes to 2 causes bottleneck and traffic increasing up to 500,000 annually , nationally

attributes.action: Build new and expand, grammar schools in England to provide quality education.
attributes.background: Recently Warwickshire council eleven plus exam was held. There were a couple of thousands of pupils who sat for the exam. But there are only about 300 to 400 places in the grammar schools in Warwickshire.  Please allow more and do not ban outright on the grounds of social mobility.
attributes.additional_details: The parents who want their child to study in grammar schools need to go through lot of struggles now.  House prices in grammar school catchment area is very high. As the population grows, demand for grammar schools among low and middle class families increased many folds. Allowing more grammar schools would only provide more choices to the parents and help social mobility. A blanket ban would cause more pressure to many hard working parents who wants to provide quality education.

attributes.action: Make patent infringement a criminal offence in the UK.
attributes.background: Patent infringement is commonplace. Personally and according to the Intellectual Property's Office's opinion I have experienced this directly.  However, as individual or small business trying to stop such trespass the cost is prohibitive as the penalties for unauthorised IPR's use is insufficient.
attributes.additional_details: Innovators who develop products look to protect such technology.  Enjoying rewards from inspiration made real are huge motivators. However, it is true to say, "patents are not worth the paper they are written on if not policed".  Unauthorised patent use is crushing for those who lack means. Business know this and take comfort at little or no penalty for their actions.  Our world is built on ideas, so why do we not protect the innovators? Steal the idea, steals the motivation and steals growth.

attributes.action: To have a 'No Bullying' Campaign/Policy in all educational sites across the UK.
attributes.background: During my time at school I had my fair share of bullying and was made to feel out of place. Speaking with local parents, who think schools don't do enough to prevent bullying, would like the government to set strict guidelines that must be followed in education for bullying, not set by the schools.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/bullying-at-school/the-law - says that policies are set by the school. If it was set by the government then all schools would be the same regarding the 'Behaviour Policy'. Schools could also teach that everyone is different have it be sexual orientation or religion, race which could prevent bullying. I will be campaigning to STOP THE BULLYING!! 

Questionnaire below:
https://www.surveymonkey.co.uk/r/LZNSF7K
Will be sent to schools and colleges around the UK for research.

attributes.action: Stop foreign workers taking British jobs in culturally important industries
attributes.background: We petition the Government to apply any immigration controls implemented Post Brexit to all industries, even culturally important ones, with very few exceptions even if the company or foreigner is extremely rich. Especially where there are young British people eager to do the jobs with the skills
attributes.additional_details: This must be applied to all, particularly to Sports clubs and especially football. The only exception should be that each club is allowed 1 coach & 1 player to be non Brit. The invasion of football with foreigners is hurting the ability of young Brits to develop & gain experience, this is hurting the national team. There are 100's of talented young Brits who could fill these roles so foreigners aren't required. Culturally significant industries are Sport, Media and Show business.

attributes.action: Introduce a job test for all prospective MPs.
attributes.background: It is necessary to complete a test for most jobs, yet currently there is no testing of candidates for membership of parliament. There is a suspicion amongst many of the public that some MPs are "out of touch" or "not fit for purpose". A test would improve public confidence.
attributes.additional_details: As an initial idea for discussion, I propose 100 questions around 10 subjects including history, maths, logic/IQ, economics, general knowledge, culture, the world, and so on. Like most tests, this test would be changed frequently, marking would be anonymous, and scores would not be published. A candidate would only know they had passed or failed, with a pass mark being perhaps 80%. A candidate would be entitled to a second attempt, but only after the current election had ended.

attributes.action: Make all UK schools enforce their school bullying policies legally
attributes.background: Schools legally have to have bullying policies but they do not legally have to enforce their policies as they currently only have discretionary meaning. They legally don't have any powers to enforce their policies and this has to be changed for safety well-being of all children's no 1 priority.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics released say 1.5 million pupils are bullied verbally or physically or both in the last 12 months which was on national news TV etc. Therefore it's children's and pupils' lives that are being ruined and destroyed and society in general and schools are failing to act cause of current policies and legislations and have no powers.
attributes.creator_name: Stephen McCulloch On Behalf Of Anti Bullying Ambassadors

attributes.action: Make TA and Reserve service pensionable employment retrospectively.
attributes.background: Many thousands of men and women have sacrificed weekends and nights training and augmenting the regular forces as well as mobilisation to war zones. In some cases well over 20 or 30 years and in some cases more without any pension rights. Pensions should reflect there time in service.
attributes.additional_details: Northern Ireland, Bosnia, Irak, Afghanistan just for example.

attributes.action: Incorporate Scotland's Place in Europe in UK BREXIT negotiations and final deal
attributes.background: The Scottish Government produced their paper "Scotland's Place in Europe" in 2016 to discuss options on how Scotland, together with the UK should negotiate its position within BREXIT. The UK government must act upon this document and actively aim to achieve and enforce it on behalf of all Scots.
attributes.additional_details: The people of Scotland democratically voted to remain part of the UK, to remain part of the EU and support federalism (refer to public consultation analysis of Smith Commission - over 80% of 18,000 individuals wanted DevoMax). The Scottish Government's BREXIT proposals clearly respond to the will of the majority of the Scottish people. Therefore, it is imperative that the UK Government positively act on this and agree a differential deal for Scotland based on a "reverse Greenland" precedent.

attributes.action: Ban refugees entering Britain until we are out of the EU
attributes.background: We must stop anymore refugees arriving in Britain until we are out of the EU. And we can then control who comes with more secure checks in identities

attributes.action: Now is not the time to seek deeper US relations. Delay triggering Article 50.
attributes.background: The British people want greater control over immigration, but not come what may. Now is not time to seek deeper economic relations across the Atlantic if it means giving up who we are. We call on Parliament to take stock of the changed circumstances and to delay triggering Article 50.

attributes.action: Make physical education take place every day during school for one hour
attributes.background: In the UK Obesity is on the rise and its something that can be controlled.We the people of the UK need to take action and quickly.A majority of people do not take part in regular exercise each day.we require at least one hours exercise each day and may find it hard to make time for exercise daily
attributes.additional_details: Obesity has risen for men has risen from 22% up to 30% since the year 2000 that's over a quarter of the United Kingdom's male population that is obese

attributes.action: Heavier prison scentences for pedophiles and rapists.
attributes.background: I firmly believe that the scentences handed out to pedophiles and rapists are far to lenient.When someone commits a crime against a child or rapes a person they are as good as murdering who that person once was
attributes.additional_details: Anyone who has been raped or abused will tell you they will never be the same again...in essence the person they once were is now dead...children who are abused have their childhood stolen from them..the perpetrators of such unspeakble acts deserve to be punished severly and the victims at the very least deserve the justice that harsher scentences would bring

attributes.action: Unban Tyler, The Creator from entering the UK
attributes.background: The US rapper Tyler, the Creator says he has been banned from the UK because of the nature of his lyrics however i believe this is unjust. He should not have been banned for lyrics he wrote 6-7 years prior and i believe his ban should be lifted, however he hasn't written lyrics like that since.
attributes.additional_details:
The letter from the secretary of state for the home department at the time sated in a letter sent to Tyler that his lyrics “encourages violence and intolerance of homosexuality” 

His manager went into more detail on his Tumblr, saying 
more importantly, this is a broader issue of free speech, the letter acknowledged he was writing from an alter ego perspective does this then apply to book writers? What message does that send? is race a conscious or subconscious factor at all?
